contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox album | <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Qui sème le vent récolte le tempo | Type = [[Album]] | Artist = [[MC Solaar]] | Cover = Qui sème le vent récolte le tempo.jpg | Released = October 15, 1991 | Recorded = 1990–91 | Genre = [[French hip hop]] | Length = 51:41 | Label = Musicrama Records | Producer = [[Jimmy Jay]] | This album = ''Qui sème le vent récolte le tempo''<br>(1991) | Next album = ''[[Prose Combat]]''<br>(1994) }} {{Album ratings | rev1 = [[Allmusic]] | rev1Score = {{Rating|4|5}} <ref>[{{Allmusic|class=album|id=r208833|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic review]</ref> | noprose = yes }} '''''Qui sème le vent récolte le tempo''''' is [[French hip hop|French rapper]] [[MC Solaar]]'s first album. The title is a pun on the [[French language|French]] version of the Biblical proverb "''{{lang|fr|qui sème le vent récolte la tempête}}''" (he who sows the wind reaps the whirlwind, [[Book of Hosea|Hosea]] 8:7). The song samples [[Lou Donaldson]]'s ''One Cylinder''. It was released in 1991 and gained enormous success. ''Bouge de là'' was the album's first single, which was hugely successful in France and went on to kickstart Solaar's career there. The song is based on a sample of ''The Message'' by 1970s English band [[Cymande]]. Other popular singles from the album are ''Caroline'' and ''Bouge de là (Part 1)''. ==Track listing== # "Intro" (instrumental) # "Qui sème le vent récolte le tempo" # "Matière grasse contre matière grise" # "Victime de la mode" # "L'histoire de l'art" # "Armand est mort" # "Quartier nord" # "Interlude" (instrumental) # "A temps partiel" # "Caroline" # "La musique adoucit les mœurs" # "[[Bouge de là]] (part. 1)" # "Bouge de là (part. 2) (impro)" # "Ragga Jam (impro)" # "La devise" # "Funky Dreamer" (instrumental) ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.rncb.ac.uk/dl8004/quiseme.htm Dave's MC Solaar Archive] {{MC Solaar}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Qui Seme Le Vent Recolte Le Tempo}} [[Category:1991 debut albums]] [[Category:MC Solaar albums]]
